intro: Ditassa burchellii, commonly known as the yellow oxalis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Oxalidaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
